citations.narrative:
The facility shipped non-human primates more than 10 days past the inspection dates as recorded on the Certificates of
Veterinary Inspection.
-The facility sent 34 long tailed macaques to another facility in Nevada. The health certificate for the transport had a Date
Inspected, December 12, 2024, that was more than 10 days prior to the Ship Date, January 8, 2025.
-The facility sent 19 rhesus macaques to another facility in Louisiana. The health certificate for the transport had a Date
Inspected, January 9, 2025, that was more than 10 days prior to the Ship Date, January 27, 2025.
To ensure the health of the animals prior to transport, the health certificate must certify that the licensed veterinarian
inspected the animals no more than 10 days prior to delivery for transport.
No research facility shall deliver to any intermediate handler or carrier for transportation, in commerce, or shall transport in
commerce any nonhuman primate unless the nonhuman primate is accompanied by a health certificate executed and
issued by a licensed veterinarian. The health certificate shall state that the licensed veterinarian inspected the nonhuman
primate on a specified date which shall not be more than 10 days prior to the delivery of the nonhuman primate for
transportation.
Correct from this day forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.38(h)(1)(i) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
The facility shipped non-human primates more than 10 days past the inspection dates as recorded on the Certificates of 
Veterinary Inspection. 
 
-The facility sent 34 long tailed macaques to another facility in Nevada. The health certificate for the transport had a Date 
Inspected, December 12, 2024, that was more than 10 days prior to the Ship Date, January 8, 2025.  
 
-The facility sent 19 rhesus macaques to another facility in Louisiana. The health certificate for the transport had a Date 
Inspected, January 9, 2025, that was more than 10 days prior to the Ship Date, January 27, 2025.  
 
To ensure the health of the animals prior to transport, the health certificate must certify that the licensed veterinarian 
inspected the animals no more than 10 days prior to delivery for transport. 
 
No research facility shall deliver to any intermediate handler or carrier for transportation, in commerce, or shall transport in 
commerce any nonhuman primate unless the nonhuman primate is accompanied by a health certificate executed and 
issued by a licensed veterinarian. The health certificate shall state that the licensed veterinarian inspected the nonhuman 
primate on a specified date which shall not be more than 10 days prior to the delivery of the nonhuman primate for 
transportation. 
 
Correct from this day forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
